availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Farmer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed George Hast as an overseer in Henderson County in 1850. Employed Bluford Noel as a laborer in Henderson County in 1850. Owned twenty-six enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Henderson County in 1860. Guardian for J. J. Wanada. Employed Leonard A. Robertson and Jacob Pecane as farmhands in Henderson County in 1860. Owned thirty-nine enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1, p. 306B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1, p. 532.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 214-15.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 175A.
